SEARCH
Package logic

Class Logic

java.lang.Object
logic.Logic
public class Logic extends Object
The Logic class is responsible for managing the network of equipos (devices) and conexiones (connections). It provides methods to manipulate the graph, such as adding, modifying, and deleting vertices and edges, as well as performing various network operations like finding the shortest path and checking for cycles.

  • Constructor Details

    • Logic

      public Logic()
      Constructs a new Logic instance. Initializes the graph, vertexMap, and edgesMap.

  • Method Details

    • getGraph

      public org.jgrapht.Graph<Equipo,Conexion> getGraph()
      Retrieves the graph representing the network of equipos (devices) and conexiones (connections).
      Returns:
      the graph representing the network

    • setCoordinator

      public void setCoordinator(Coordinator coordinator)
      Sets the coordinator for the logic.
      Parameters:
      coordinator - the Coordinator object to be set

    • getVertexMap

      public Map<String,Equipo> getVertexMap()
      Retrieves the map of vertexes (equipos) in the graph.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are strings representing the device identifiers, and the values are Equipo objects representing the devices

    • updateData

      public void updateData(List<Equipo> equipos, List<Conexion> conexiones)
      Updates the graph data with the provided lists of equipos (vertices) and conexiones (edges). This method clears the existing graph and repopulates it with the new data.
      Parameters:
      equipos - a list of Equipo objects representing the vertices to be added to the graph
      conexiones - a list of Conexion objects representing the edges to be added to the graph

    • addVertex

      public void addVertex(Equipo equipo) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a vertex (equipo) to the graph.
      Parameters:
      equipo - the vertex (equipo) to be added to the graph
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • modifyVertex

      public void modifyVertex(Equipo equipo) throws InvalidEquipoException
      Modifies a vertex (equipo) in the graph.

      This method first saves all the connections of the equipo to be modified. It then removes the equipo from the graph, updates the vertex map, and adds the equipo back to the graph. Finally, it re-adds all the saved connections to the equipo.

      Parameters:
      equipo - the vertex (equipo) to be modified in the graph
      Throws:
      InvalidEquipoException - if the equipo does not exist in the graph

    • deleteVertex

      public void deleteVertex(Equipo equipo) throws InvalidEquipoException
      Deletes a vertex (equipo) from the graph.

      This method removes the specified equipo from the graph and also removes all associated edges (conexiones) connected to the equipo. Additionally, it removes the equipo from the equipos map.

      Parameters:
      equipo - the vertex (equipo) to be removed from the graph
      Throws:
      InvalidEquipoException - if the equipo does not exist in the graph

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge(Conexion conexion) throws InvalidConexionException
      Adds an edge (conexion) to the graph.

      This method first checks if the edge already exists in the graph. If it does, an InvalidConexionException is thrown. It then validates the edge, adds it to the graph, and sets the edge weight based on the connection's cable speed. If adding the edge forms a cycle, the edge is removed and an InvalidConexionException is thrown. Finally, the edge is added to the edgesMap.

      Parameters:
      conexion - the edge (conexion) to be added to the graph
      Throws:
      InvalidConexionException - if the edge already exists or if adding the edge forms a cycle

    • modifyEdge

      public void modifyEdge(Conexion conexion) throws InvalidConexionException
      Modifies an edge (conexion) in the graph.

      This method modifies the edge weight of the specified conexion based on the connection's cable speed.

      Parameters:
      conexion - the edge (conexion) to be modified in the graph
      Throws:
      InvalidConexionException

    • deleteEdge

      public void deleteEdge(Conexion conexion) throws InvalidConexionException
      Deletes an edge (conexion) from the graph.

      This method removes the specified conexion from the graph and also removes the conexion from the conexiones map. If the conexion does not exist in the graph, an InvalidConexionException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      conexion - the edge (conexion) to be removed from the graph
      Throws:
      InvalidConexionException - if the conexion does not exist in the graph

    • shortestPath

      public List<Conexion> shortestPath(Equipo origin, Equipo end)
      Finds the shortest path between two devices (equipos) in the network.

      This method uses Dijkstra's algorithm to find the shortest path between the origin and end devices. If no path exists, it returns null.

      Parameters:
      origin - the starting device (equipo) for the path
      end - the ending device (equipo) for the path
      Returns:
      a list of Conexion objects representing the shortest path, or null if no path exists

    • maxBandwith

      public double maxBandwith(List<Conexion> path)
      Calculates the maximum bandwidth along a given path.
      Parameters:
      path - a list of Conexion objects representing the path
      Returns:
      the maximum bandwidth (minimum weight) along the path

    • ping

      public boolean ping(String ip)
      Pings a given IP address to check if it is active.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address to ping
      Returns:
      true if the IP address is active, false otherwise

    • pingRange

      public Map<String,Boolean> pingRange(Collection<String> ips)
      Pings a range of IP addresses to check if they are active.
      Parameters:
      ips - a collection of IP addresses to ping
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are IP addresses and the values are booleans indicating if the IP address is active

    • mapStatus

      public Map<Equipo,Boolean> mapStatus()
      Creates a map of the current status of all equipos (devices) connected to the network.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are Equipo objects and the values are booleans indicating if the equipo is active

    • getConnectedPart

      public org.jgrapht.Graph<Equipo,Conexion> getConnectedPart(Equipo vertex)
      Retrieves the connected part of the network starting from a given vertex. This method creates a new graph containing only the vertices and edges that are reachable from the specified vertex using a Depth-First Search (DFS) approach.
      Parameters:
      vertex - the starting vertex from which the connected part is determined
      Returns:
      a new graph containing the connected part of the network
